title: Documentation Management (Shelly's Domain)

content.content: As FedRAMP Coordinator, Shelly manages our compliance documentation in Google Drive. This section covers the essentials of keeping our documents organized and audit-ready.

items: Use the shared FedRAMP folder - no compliance docs in personal drives
Follow naming convention: `YYYY-MM-DD_DocumentType`
Set up notifications for changes to critical documents
Only give access to people who need it

content.content: Google Drive tracks version history automatically. Don't overcomplicate it.
You're the bridge between ScaleSec and the team:

items: Know where evidence lives in Drive
Route technical questions to Pete
Coordinate policy approvals with Pete or Dave
Provide requested documents quickly
**POA&M Updates**: Get status from Pete by the 5th
**Training Records**: Update completion dates
**Evidence Filing**: Ensure scan results are saved
**Calendar Check**: Review upcoming deadlines

content.content: Never let POA&M items go overdue. Alert Pete 2 weeks before deadlines.

items: Keep evidence organized by control family
Ensure all documents have clear timestamps
Create auditor access folders when needed
Flag missing evidence to Pete immediately

content.content: Follow our retention policy - don't delete compliance documents. Archive old versions in clearly dated folders.
Use one spreadsheet or the LMS to track:

items: Training completion dates
Policy review dates
POA&M status
Evidence locations

content.content: For a 6-person team, complex tracking systems waste time. Keep it simple and consistent.

keyTakeaways: Google Drive is our FedRAMP documentation repository - keep it organized and secure
Monthly tasks: POA&M updates, training records, evidence filing
Stay audit-ready year-round - don't scramble at audit time
Keep tracking simple - one system for our small team
